1.text: This is the book of the lineage of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him to the likeness of God.

2.text: He created them, male and female; and he blessed them. And he called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.

3.text: Then Adam lived for one hundred and thirty years. And then he conceived a son in his own image and likeness, and he called his name Seth.

4.text: And after he conceived Seth, the days of Adam that passed were eight hundred years. And he conceived sons and daughters.

5.text: And all the time that passed while Adam lived was nine hundred and thirty years, and then he died.

6.text: Seth likewise lived for one hundred and five years, and then he conceived Enos.

7.text: And after he conceived Enos, Seth lived for eight hundred and seven years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

8.text: And all the days of Seth that passed were nine hundred and twelve years, and then he died.

9.text: In truth, Enos lived ninety years, and then he conceived Cainan.

10.text: After his birth, he lived eight hundred and fifteen years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

11.text: And all the days of Enos that passed were nine hundred and five years, and then he died.

12.text: Likewise, Cainan lived seventy years, and then he conceived Mahalalel.

13.text: And after he conceived Mahalalel, Cainan lived for eight hundred and forty years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

14.text: And all the days of Cainan that passed were nine hundred and ten years, and then he died.

15.text: And Mahalalel lived sixty-five years, and then he conceived Jared.

16.text: And after he conceived Jared, Mahalalel lived for eight hundred and thirty years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

17.text: And all the days of Mahalalel that passed were eight hundred and ninety-five years, and then he died.

18.text: And Jared lived for one hundred and sixty-two years, and then he conceived Enoch.

19.text: And after he conceived Enoch, Jared lived for eight hundred years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

20.text: And all the days of Jared that passed were nine hundred and sixty-two years, and then he died.

21.text: Now Enoch lived for sixty-five years, and then he conceived Methuselah.

22.text: And Enoch walked with God. And after he conceived Methuselah, he lived for three hundred years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

23.text: And all the days of Enoch that passed were three hundred and sixty-five years.

24.text: And he walked with God, and then he was seen no more, because God took him.

25.text: Likewise, Methuselah lived for one hundred and eighty-seven years, and then he conceived Lamech.

26.text: And after he conceived Lamech, Methuselah lived for seven hundred and eighty-two years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

27.text: And all the days of Methuselah that passed were nine hundred and sixty-nine years, and then he died.

28.text: Then Lamech lived for one hundred and eighty-two years, and he conceived a son.

29.text: And he called his name Noah, saying, “This one will console us from the works and hardships of our hands, in the land that the Lord has cursed.”

30.text: And after he conceived Noah, Lamech lived for five hundred and ninety-five years, and he conceived sons and daughters.

31.text: And all the days of Lamech that passed were seven hundred and seventy-seven years, and then he died.

32.text: In truth, when Noah was five hundred years old, he conceived Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
